c74object.name: fluid.chroma~
c74object.digest: An histogram of pitch classes in Real-Time

div.p: This class computes a histogram of the energy contained for each pitch class across the analysis frequency range.

c74object.discussion:
Open the Overview Patch
Also known as a chromagram, this typically allows you to get a contour of how much each semitone is represented in the spectrum over time. The number of chroma bins (and, thus, pitch classes) and the central reference frequency can be adjusted.
The process will return a multichannel control steam of size maxNumChroma, which will be repeated if no change happens within the algorithm, i.e. when the hopSize is larger than the signal vector size.
fluid.chroma~ is part of the Fluid Decomposition Toolkit of the FluCoMa project. For more explanations, learning material, and discussions on its musicianly uses, visit flucoma.org.

div.p: The maximum number of chroma bins. This sets the number of channels of the output stream, and therefore cannot be modulated.
How large can the FFT be, by allocating memory at instantiation time. This cannot be modulated.

method.name: reset
method.digest: Return the object to its original state
method.description: Calling reset will change parameter values back to those the object was created with, i.e. any attribute values set in the box will be retained

div.p: FFT settings consist of three numbers representing the window size, hop size and FFT size in samples:
The hop size and fft size can both be set to -1 (and are by default), with slightly different meanings:

ul.li: For the FFT size, -1 = windowSize snapped to the nearest equal / greater power of 2 (e.g. windowSize 1024 => fftSize 1024, but windowsSize 1000 also => fftSize 1024)
FFTSize, if != -1, will set to the next greatest power of two > 4
The maximum manual FFT size is limited to the value of the maxfftsize initialization argument
if FFT size != -1, then window size is clipped at FFT size

div.p: The highest frequency included in the analysis, in Hz.
The lower frequency included in the analysis, in Hz.
This flag enables the scaling of the output. It is off (0) by default. (1) will normalise each frame to sum to 1. (2) normalises each frame relative to the loudest chroma bin being 1.

attribute.name: numchroma
attribute.digest: Number of Chroma Bins per Octave

div.p: The number of chroma bins per octave. It will determine how many channels are output per input channel.

div.blockquote: The frequency of reference in Hz for the tuning of the middle A (default: 440 Hz)
